pages.title: ⍟ Four of Pentacles ⍟
pages.text: Spirit of Earthy Power$(br)    ☉ Sun in ♑ Capricorn

A lonely figure, sitting in the outskirts of their town.$(br)  They have a pentacle over their crown, clasp another with hands and arms; two pentacles are under their feet.$(br)  Sitting still, they have worries on their mind, anxious that anyone might take away their fixations.$(br)  They hold to that which they have.$(br)  Traditionally, this card represents the protection and power of possessions.$(br)  It serves us as a reminder

to honor and respect wealth, and of the consequence of being so attached to it in detriment of other most important things.$(br)  We know the ideal realizes itself in the physical. We must also know that it is not physicality itself, but the different ideals working within it, that give power.$(br)  In other words, we best fulfill our ideals through our means with actual investment in the world, and not in the hoarding of rewards.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Power derived from skill or possessions. Structure, legacy, inheritance.$(br)  Cleaving to that which one has. Avarice.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Letting things go, lack of concern for material things.$(br)  Possibly a need for more structure, security, certainty in inner or outer life.
